biogHist.abstract: The Anglican Orphanages Board of Management was the body formed to replace Orphanages' Committee to govern Anglican orphanages and children's homes in Perth. In 1954 the Anglican Orphanages Board of Management was replaced by the Anglican Homes Board.
biogHist.p: In The Noisy Mansions (1986, pp.129, 210-214), former Director of Swan Homes and Swanleigh, Roy Peterkin gave an overview of the role of the Anglican Orphanages Board of Management and other boards and committees of the Anglican Diocese of Perth which governed Anglican children's homes.
From 1941, the Anglican Synod formed half the membership of the Anglican Orphanages Board of Management.

Until 1949, the Anglican Orphanages Board of Management had no role or responsibility in the governance of the Parkerville Children's Home. However, around 1947, the Manager of the Swan Homes joined the Parkerville Association (which was the board of management of the Parkerville Children's Home). In 1949, the Anglican Orphanages Board of Management 'was declared the authorised board of management of the Parkerville Children's Home Association' with limited responsibilities (including publicity, liaison with the Child Welfare Department, financial management and expenditure up to &pound5000). However, the Anglican Orphanages Board of management still had to report to the Parkerville Children's Home Association and obtain approval for capital expenditures above the delegation. During the 1950s, the Incorporation documents of the Parkerville Association were amended to increase the powers of the Association and provide that 'its membership should consist of those persons who for the time being held the office of Diocesan Trustee or that of Diocesan Secretary' (Peterkin, p.129).
In 1954, the Anglican Orphanages Board of Management was replaced by the Anglican Homes Board.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: State Archives Collection of Western Australia (1829 - )
Anglican Diocese of Perth, Western Australia, Records (1880s - 2010)

descriptiveNote.p: The Anglican Orphanages Board of Management included senior members of the Anglican Diocese of Perth.
The Anglican Orphanages Board of Management had a management role at Parkerville Children's Home, and reported to the Parkerville Children's Home Incorporated.
The Anglican Orphanages Board of Management had a management role at the Parkerville Children's Home.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Minutes of conference of representatives of institutions accommodating migrant children

archref.unittitle: Minutes of conference of representatives of institutions accommodating migrant children
archref.abstract: Minutes of conference of representatives of institutions accommodating migrant children' is an excerpt from the digital copy of the Moss John - visiting Child Welfare Expert file from the National Archives of Australia website. It gives insight into the process of migrating children to Australia from Britain, and the inspection of their welfare after they arrive.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Anglican Homes Response to Moss Questionnaire

archref.unittitle: Anglican Homes Response to Moss Questionnaire
archref.abstract: 'Anglican Homes Response to Moss Questionnaire' is an excerpt from the digital copy of the Moss John - visiting Child Welfare Expert file from the National Archives of Australia website. It is a letter from the Anglican Homes for Children, responding to questions about the Swan Homes, Midland.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Enquiry by Mr. John Moss. Points on which information is needed as to provision for the welfare of children emigrating from the United Kingdom to Australia

archref.unittitle: Enquiry by Mr. John Moss. Points on which information is needed as to provision for the welfare of children emigrating from the United Kingdom to Australia
archref.abstract: 'Enquiry by Mr. John Moss. Points on which information is needed as to provision for the welfare of children emigrating from the United Kingdom to Australia' is an excerpt from the digital copy of the Moss John - visiting Child Welfare Expert file from the National Archives of Australia website. It is the questionnaire that was circulated to government, the organisations that received and placed child migrants, and the children's Homes where the children lived. This questionnaire was received by the Commonwealth Government on 10 May 1951.
